flipsiesNft.title: Flipsies NFT
flipsiesNft.text1: FlipsiesNFT is a series of 7,803 playing cards on the TRON/BTTC blockchain, each NFT is uniquely programmatically auto-colored.
flipsiesNft.text3: 2,600 kings, 2,601 queens, 2,601 jacks, 25 jokers and 7 one-of-ones.
flipsiesNft.text4: When an NFT is staked you will have an earning rate for betting and trading on flipsies, the earning power for the NFT will be based on its rarity score. The more NFTs staked, the more you will earn.
flipsiesNft.text5: Over the years many different nicknames have been given to distinctive playing cards. Most of these bynames have came from poker games, these are several of the classic bynames that have been designated to cards.
flipsiesNft.text6: To gain access to our NFT marketplace, play-to-win or mint 1, 3 or 5 randomly generated NFTs!

explore.title: Explore Flipsies NFT
explore.tryLuck: Try your luck, buy a random NFT now and see which one you'll get!
explore.notEligible: is not eligible for any Jackpot NFTs

kingOfHearts.title: Suicide King
kingOfHearts.label: The King of Hearts is usually depicted with a sword, although in the flipsies deck he is armed with a color changing egg. He is typically referred to as the "suicide king" because on a traditional deck he is pictured as stabbing himself with a sword, or at least holding a sword behind his head.

kingOfDiamonds.title: Man With The Axe
kingOfDiamonds.label: This designation for the King of Diamonds reflects the fact that this is the only king not carrying a sword. That is why he is often referred to as The Man With The Axe. This card is frequently designated as wildcards in home games of draw poker. At the local card game, It was common to hear "the game is seven card high/low with a buy on the last card. And just to make it more interesting, the man with the axe takes all.

queenOfSpades.title: Black Widow
queenOfSpades.label: The nickname "Black Widow" for the Queen of Spades is closely connected with the game of Hearts. In this trick-taking game, the idea is to avoid collecting points, with Hearts cards all worth one point each, while the Queen of Spades costs a massive 13 penalty points. In old-school poker games, youâ€™d sometimes hear her referred to as Calamity Jane, a famous frontierswoman that loved to play 5-card stud.

queenOfClubs.title: Flower Queen
queenOfClubs.label: The Queen of Clubs is known as the "Queen of flowers" or the "Flower Queen" for an obvious reason - she is usually depicted holding a Flower. Also called the "Mother Mary" card or the "Queen of Queens" this is also the most speculated card for tarot readings and other psychic beliefs.

jackOfDiamonds.title: Laughing Boy
jackOfDiamonds.label: Jacks are also called Knaves, and are inferior to the more regal Kings and Queens, making them more playful. The Jack of Diamonds is known as the Laughing Boy, and in some variations of Poker and Black Jack, players are expected to chuckle every time this card is played or drawn.

jackOfSpadesAndJackOfHearts.title: One Eyed Jacks
jackOfSpadesAndJackOfHearts.label: Unlike most of the other court cards, the Jack of Spades and the Jack of Hearts both have a side profile, hence their designation as "one-eyed Jacks." One eyed jacks is a phrase most often used to describe cards that are being declared wild. It is a convenient way to specify that half the jacks should be wild, and as an ancient part of poker slang, it's also just fun to say. One eyed jacks are often paired with the "Suicide King" in declaring wild cards.

footer.text: Flipsies offers an online gambling experience. You must be over 18 years old to click on any gambling related activities on Flipsies. If you reside in a location where gambling, lotteries or internet betting is illegal you must not click on anything found on this website. Flipsies- will not be held responsible for any violation of local laws enforced in your region. Flipsies games are based on fairness, transparency and fun. Players should be aware of the risks and manage themselves accordingly. Please gamble and play responsibly.
